name: MATH 115
title: Graph Theory
description: Graph theory, trees, vertex and edge colorings, Hamilton cycles, Eulerian circuits, decompositions into isomorphic subgraphs, extremal problems, cages, Ramsey theory, Cayley's spanning tree formula, planar graphs, Euler's formula, crossing numbers, thickness, splitting numbers, magic graphs, graceful trees, rotations, and genus of graphs.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): MATH 21 or AM 10 and either MATH 100 or CSE 101.

class_notes: Sections begin Tuesday, Jan. 16th for Winter 2024.
